citation:Description.dsDescription:Text:
Supplementary files associated with PhD thesis Chapter 3 - The impact of diagenetic processes on sediment-hosted massive sulfide ore distribution: Geochronological, stratigraphic, textural, and petrographic relationships between silica, barite and sulfides in the Anarraaq Zn-Pb-Ag deposit, Red Dog District, Alaska. This includes one figure and one data table.

Figure S3.1: Drill core sub-sampled for Re-Os isotopic analysis.

Table S3.1: Whole rock analyses of select subsamples of Anarraaq black shale analyzed for Re-Os.

These data are also included as Fig. A1 and Tab. A1 in a manuscript submitted to Economic Geology.

ore:describes.Subject: Earth and Environmental Sciences
ore:describes.Title: Supplementary data for 'Chapter 3: The impact of diagenetic processes on sediment-hosted massive sulfide ore distribution: Geochronological, stratigraphic, textural, and petrographic relationships between silica, barite and sulfides in the Anarraaq Zn-Pb-Ag deposit, Red Dog District, Alaska'

Related Publication.Citation: Reynolds, MA (2019) Sediment-hosted Zn-Pb-Ag mineralization in the Red Dog district, Alaska, USA: pre-ore environments and mineralizing processes. PhD Thesis, University of Alberta, Edmonton. https://doi.org/10.7939/r3-mmsk-9x89

ore:describes.schema:name: Supplementary data for 'Chapter 3: The impact of diagenetic processes on sediment-hosted massive sulfide ore distribution: Geochronological, stratigraphic, textural, and petrographic relationships between silica, barite and sulfides in the Anarraaq Zn-Pb-Ag deposit, Red Dog District, Alaska'

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Figure S3.1: Drill core sub-sampled for Re-Os isotopic analysis. Top of core is to the left in all samples. (a) Sample 923-2123.1 – split core. Organic-rich mudstone contains minor calcite veinlets and patches of disseminated pyrite; these were avoided during sub-sampling. (b) Sample 1716-2521 – cut and wetted core. Nodular pre-ore pyrite in Ikalukrok mudstone. (c) Sample 1723-2104.9 – cut and wetted core. Ore-stage pyrite in large hydrothermal pyrite-calcite-quartz vein. Only samples of Py4a were used in isochron.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Reynolds (2019) Figure S3.1.pdf
